Pre-Game Insights: Nepal's captain Rohit Paudel is confident that his side will start the T20 World Cup with a win against Netherlands
Netherlands’ coach Ryan Cook said his team will be wary of the threat Nepal pose
Paudel said his squad have been feeling nervous ahead of the tournament but they are ready to get going against one of their closest rivals on the associate cricket circuit
Cook said the Dutch will not be intimidated by the presence of a large Nepali crowd
Paudel said he’s been “getting goosebumps” thinking about the match
Cook believes both sides match up evenly
Nepal’s supporters are expected to throng the match venue in the suburbs of Dallas, which is home to a large South Asian community in Texas
Miscellaneous Highlights: Dallas hosted the tournament’s opening game, which turned out to be a high-scoring encounter that USA won late into the night
The pitch is expected to remain the same, dew will not come into play as this will be a day game, with the sun beating down on the ground
Nepal and Netherlands have come up against each other on a few occasions recently and their most recent meeting came in a T20 international (T20I) series in Kirtipur, Nepal
The Dutch edged the hosts 2-1 in the closely matched series as well as their overall head-to-head record
Netherlands: L L L W W, Nepal: L L W W W
Netherlands team news: Michael Levitt could get his T20 World Cup debut on the back of his recent form with the bat
Nepal team news: Dipendra Airee will be the one to watch with the bat in a side packed with all-rounders
